quiz.title: Unit 1: Foundations & Measurement (Quiz 9)
quiz.subtitle: Units, Conversions, and Metric Prefixes (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: Candela is the unit of:
questions.explanation: Candela (cd) is the SI base unit for luminous intensity, measuring the brightness of a light source in a particular direction.

questions.question: If $A = 34\,\text{m}$, $B = 234\,\text{cm}$, and $C = 449\,\text{mm}$, what is $A + B + C$?
If $A = 7\,\text{m}$, $B = 130\,\text{cm}$, and $C = 723\,\text{mm}$, what is $A + B + C$?
If $98.12$ is divided by $2.32$, the correct result in terms of significant figures is:
questions.explanation: $98.12 \div 2.32 = 42.2931...$ $98.12$ has 4 sig figs, $2.32$ has 3 sig figs. Result must have 3 sig figs: $42.3$.

questions.question: If the values from five trials for an experiment are: $10.2$, $10.6$, $10.8$, $10.5$, and $10.1$, what should be our recorded value?
questions.explanation: Sum $= 52.2$, mean $= 52.2 \div 5 = 10.44$. Considering the precision of measurements (1 decimal place), round to $10.4$.

questions.question: What instrument might I use to measure the thickness of a paper?
questions.explanation: Paper thickness is extremely small ($\approx 0.1\,\text{mm}$). A micrometer screw gauge with least count $0.01\,\text{mm}$ is most appropriate.

questions.question: Which of the following represents a gigameter?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'giga-' (G) means $10^9$. So $1$ gigameter $= 10^9$ meters.

questions.question: Which of the following represents a micrometer?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'micro-' ($\mu$) means $10^{-6}$. So $1$ micrometer $= 10^{-6}$ meters.

questions.question: Which of the following represents a megagram?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'mega-' (M) means $10^6$. So $1$ megagram $= 10^6$ grams. ($1$ megagram $= 1$ metric tonne)

questions.question: Which of the following represents a teragram?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'tera-' (T) means $10^{12}$. So $1$ teragram $= 10^{12}$ grams.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered SI units and metric prefixes.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review unit conversions and significant figures.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on metric prefix meanings and calculations.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study the SI base units and practice converting between units.
